title: Kate Garraway left red-faced after admitting she wears “heated knickers” LIVE on Good Morning Britain

As temperatures plunged in London last night, the worlds’ most glamorous actresses were left shivering in their gowns on the red carpet at the BAFTAs. 
But Kate Garraway admitted that she has a secret weapon to keeping warm when reporting in a chilly location for Good Morning Britain – heated knickers. 
Talking about Game of Thrones actress Sophie Turner, Richard Arnold the Entertainment Editor revealed that she was wearing “heated pads” on the small of her back. 
“I’ve got those!” Kate exclaimed. “I have underwear, heated knickers.” Kate Garraway let her heated knickers secret slip (Photo: ITV) 
And the 49-year-old TV presenter admitted that she wore her heated underwear when reporting on Donald Trump’s inauguration in Washington last month. 
“I wore them in Washington. Honestly they’re like this heated underwear, big pants with heated pads in,” she said. 
Realising that she’d just told the nation about her secret knickers, Kate added sheepishly: “Which I wasn’t going to tell everyone, as the producer just rightly reminded me.” Kate was left red-faced after the frank admission (Photo: ITV) Entertainment Editor Richard Arnold was shocked (Photo: ITV) 
Kate stayed up all night to give GMB viewers all the latest on Donald Trump’s inauguration. 
But viewers were shocked by the 49 year old’s appearance – as her makeup showed the strain of a long night. 
Kate wore dark eyeshadow and bright pink lipstick to host the live link. Read More "I'd arrive at GMB slightly breathless": Piers Morgan makes cheeky sex joke about Susanna Reid Good Morning Britain's Kate Garraway suffered multiple makeup mishaps (Photo: ITV) 
She struggled to keep her eyes open as her fake eyelashes weighed down on her eyelids and threatened to come loose. 
Meanwhile, her bright pink lipstick had rubbed off onto her white fur coat leaving an unsightly mess. 
And viewers took to Twitter to criticise Kate’s heavy-handed approach to her makeup. Read More Piers Morgan says Susanna Reid wants to 'wake up in bed with him' after 'bad Blue Monday' survey Viewers were shocked by Kate Garraway's appearance (Photo: ITV) 
One viewer tweeted that Kate’s makeup aged her “about 20 years” and suggested she sticks to more natural-looking makeup. 
Meanwhile another viewer criticised the “messy” makeup and suggested her makeup artist should be “on hand with a cotton bud”. 
Other fans tweeted that Kate looked like a “blow-up doll” thanks to her “drag queen eyelashes”. Fans tweeted their shock at Kate Garraway's makeup (Photo: Twitter) Fans were not impressed by Kate Garraway's makeup (Photo: Twitter) 
While others noticed that the TV presenter “couldn’t stop blinking” because she looked so “uncomfortable” in her “awful” fake lashes. 
Kate tweeted that she was working a “20 hour day” to keep Good Morning Britain updated with the latest from Washington. 
She also interviewed 16-year-old singer Jackie Evancho who will sing the national anthem at Donald Trump’s inauguration after many artists turned him down. Viewers suggested Kate Garraway's makeup artist should have been on hand (Photo: Twitter) 
Last year, Kate and her GMB co-host Ben Shephard were forced to defend themselves after viewers accused them of being drunk on Good Morning Britian. 
It all started when Kate accidentally spilled a glass of water across the set. 
And, rather than playing it cool, Kate then burst into a fit of giggles as she began mopping the spillage up with her production notes. Like us on Facebook
